sentences.sContent: There was still one little nagging doubt at the back of his mind.
sentences.sCn: 他的心头仍有一丝挥之不去的疑虑。
例句：金对于他讲的事情从不怀疑。

sentences.sContent: ...as there's little reason to doubt that people entering the workforce today will be called upon to play many different roles over the course of their careers...
...It is no doubt that face-to-face contact is inevitably impaired by electronic communication in the era of Internet...
...There is little doubt that further consideration must be paid to our green campus...
...but I doubt that will have anything different from what we watch now...

phrases.pCn: 假定其无过失或无罪（因无充分证据证明某人有罪）；裁判员对可疑情况无把握时不对有关运动员作不利判定
引起对…的怀疑；对…产生怀疑
辣手摧花（电影名称，又名心声疑影）

words.tran: 可疑的；令人生疑的；疑心的；不能确定的
无疑地；确定地；大概，多半
抱怀疑态度的人；不信宗教的人；怀疑论者

trans.tranOther: a feeling of being not sure whether something is true or right
to think that something may not be true or that it is unlikely
